Bio

I was born and raised in Quito, Ecuador, where I attended Universidad San Francisco de Quito for my undergraduate degrees. I received my Bachelor of Arts in Economics in December 2021 and my Bachelor of Arts in Finance in May 2022. Currently I am attending Simon Fraser University in Burnaby, Canada for my MA in Economics, and I am a co-op students at Natural Resources Canada. I participate as a Research Associate at Laboratorio de Investigación para el Desarrollo del Ecuador (LIDE)1, an Ecuadorian research nonprofit whose aim is to produce and diffuse research which can help create and promote effective public policy.

As put by Professor Daniel M. Giménez, R is my copilot - I became passionate about data analysis and visualization using R during my undergraduate studies in econometrics, and I’ve been using R as much as I can ever since.

I’m also passionate about teaching, which is why I started a Resources subpage in this website which may help a beginner get into R. I plan to expand this for new tools and fields in the future.

Apart from my work and research, I love literature, memes, playing videogames and trying new foods. I’m particularly fond of Ernesto Sábato’s books and videogames from Bethesda, Fallout 3 and 4 being my personal favorites. I’m not sure about my favorite food- maybe it’s poutine, but check back later.
